title: Joint Warfare Establishment
text:
The Joint Warfare Establishment was a British military training establishment based at <a href="Old%20Sarum">Old Sarum</a> in <a href="Wiltshire">Wiltshire</a>.
History.
The Joint Warfare Establishment was formed at Old Sarum in Wiltshire on 31 March 1963 when the <a href="School%20of%20Land/Air%20Warfare">School of Land/Air Warfare</a> (formed in 1947 at Old Sarum) was merged with the Amphibious Warfare School (formerly based at <a href="Poole">Poole</a>). Its first commandant was Air Vice-Marshal Cecil Weir. Its role was to teach officers from the three services to work as one unit when fighting local wars; typical courses lasted 10 days at a time and each course was attended by about 50 officers mainly of <a href="major">major</a> or <a href="lieutenant">lieutenant</a> rank. However the establishment also had more specialist roles as the training centre for British <a href="psychological%20warfare">psychological warfare</a> operations and as the training centre for forward air controller training. The establishment was disbanded in 1978 when such courses were transferred to the Joint Warfare Wing of the <a href="Joint%20Service%20Defence%20College">National Defence College</a> at <a href="Latimer%2C%20Buckinghamshire">Latimer</a>.
